block.p: Katharine Lawrence Hirschman, a daughter of Marianne and Robert Hirschman of Brewster, Mass., was married yesterday to Joseph Lawrence Killilea, the son of Mary Ann and Alfred Killilea of Kingston, R.I. The Rev. Jeffrey Thomas, a United Methodist minister, officiated at the Wequassett Inn in Chatham, Mass.

Mrs. Killilea, 28, graduated summa cum laude from Bucknell University and was in the Peace Corps from 1993 to 1996, teaching English in Dashhowuz, Turkmenistan. Her father, who retired as the principal of the Triangle School, an elementary school in Hillsboro, N.J., is a selectman in Brewster.

Katharine Lawrence Hirschman, a daughter of Marianne and Robert Hirschman of Brewster, Mass., was married yesterday to Joseph Lawrence Killilea, the son of Mary Ann and Alfred Killilea of Kingston, R.I. The Rev. Jeffrey Thomas, a United Methodist minister, officiated at the Wequassett Inn in Chatham, Mass.

Mrs. Killilea, 28, graduated summa cum laude from Bucknell University and was in the Peace Corps from 1993 to 1996, teaching English in Dashhowuz, Turkmenistan. Her father, who retired as the principal of the Triangle School, an elementary school in Hillsboro, N.J., is a selectman in Brewster.

Mr. Killilea, 31, teaches seventh-grade English at the Urban Collaborative Accelerated Program, an alternative public school in Providence, R.I. He graduated from Tufts University, from which he also received a master's degree in teaching. His mother is a garden designer. His father is a professor of political science at the University of Rhode Island.
